ReportSection.name: Instructions
ReportSection.title: EPIC Conference (2024)
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL, Canada’s AgeTech network, is dedicated to the creation of technologies and services that benefit older adults and caregivers. Our aim is to help older Canadians maintain their independence, health and quality of life through technologies, programs and services that increase their safety, support their independent living, and enhance their social participation.

AGE-WELL has identified 8 Challenge Areas – difficult and complex problem areas found through extensive public consultation – that demand innovation and deployment of real-world solutions. EPIC Conference (2024) is an opportunity for AGE-WELL and EPIC-AT students, postdoctoral fellows, research staff and ECRs to present their research alongside their stakeholder partners, highlight its potential impact, and connect with colleagues from around the world. Each session will also feature a new segment called Moving the Dial that highlights how AGE-WELL partners and supported startups are improving quality of life for Canada’s older adults and caregivers.

Interested AGE-WELL HQP and EPIC-AT Fellows are asked to submit an application that includes a presentation abstract and the details of a co-presenter who is an older adult, caregiver, community, or industry partner in their research. Only applications that include a stakeholder co-presenter will be considered.

HQP/EPIC-AT Fellow Presentation
All sessions will be hosted on Zoom and comprise of an introduction to the Challenge Area by the session Chair, live presentations from researchers and their stakeholder partners, and a Moving the Dial presentation. Q&A will follow the each of the presentations.

Presenters are required to accompany their 10-minute talks with a presentation of 10 slides maximum (inclusive of title slide and bibliography). They are also required to co-present alongside a stakeholder in their research. For example, this stakeholder may be an older adult or caregiver with lived experience, an industry or community partner, or government decision-maker.

Check out the EPIC Conference 2023 presentations and workshops here.

Call for Abstracts
Presentation proposals are invited from all AGE-WELL HQP and EPIC-AT Fellows including alumni. Applicants are encouraged to review the full challenge area booklet here and ensure they are available for their sessions on the dates below. Applicants may also wish to review Co-presenting tips: How to deliver an engaging and cohesive presentation

Applications will be open in Forum from March 1 to 31, 2024.
